Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Kerbalnauts,

as this is my first post I want to thank the game makes and contributers to make this thing possible. I am at the very beginning of my KSP career but I am already having a blast (actually I had several unwanted blasts already ). I have a question regarding the Communotron 16 and Comms DTS-M1. What is the actual difference between them, except the look and is there a way to improve the transmission quality like pointing the antenna towards Kerbal or something like that? I ask this because I am now at a point where I can build a Munar lander and I don't like the approach where you take all the labs and containers and stuff with you again from the surface, so I want to transmit the data and decouple my return vehicle from the lander.

Thanks,

MakeItSo!

Edited December 16, 2013 by MakeItSo

The only real difference is weight and transmission time. The DTS-M1 weighs more, has a shorter transmission time, but takes more power than the 16. (This could change with .23). Also, if you have remote tech installed that changes how they work as well.
